decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It also utilizes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its game plan. Once key creatures are in the graveyard, the deck can bring them back into play for a low cost, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to win the game by quickly reanimating large threats and controlling the game with disruption spells and card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

The main focus of this deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck relies on disruption with cards like Stifle and Daze to protect its threats while also maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is optimized for color consistency and includes utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and finish off the opponent quickly with its aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The main idea of this Legacy Bant Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble a board presence through the use of powerful creatures like Molt Tender, Kishla Skimmer, and Ice-Fang Coatl. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will and card draw/filtering with Brainstorm. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful spells like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for and put powerful creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath into play. The deck's mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. This deck aims to cheat out high cost creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize help protect the combo pieces while disruption spells like Daze and Brazen Borrower provide control against the opponent's plays. The deck seeks to establish a dominant board presence and win the game through powerful reanimated creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The deck features a mix of creature removal, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to find key pieces and close out the game efficiently. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games, while the mana base is optimized for strong consistency and utility with cards like Wasteland and Karakas.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Using a combination of efficient removal spells and countermagic, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection to find the right answers at the right time. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful threats, this deck looks to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also building up its own resources. It utilizes cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Exploration to maximize land value and consistency. The deck aims to create powerful land combinations such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate threats while also using utility lands like Wasteland and Maze of Ith to control the opponent's board. It also includes some hate cards like Bojuka Bog and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play at a low cost. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for card draw and potential reanimation targets, making the deck more versatile. The deck also has control elements like Brazen Borrower and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands as a resource. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation to disrupt their mana base. The key win condition is to assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale to further control the game. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through land-based control strategies.

The core idea of this deck revolves around using the combo of Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a powerful synergy that allows for card draw and potentially infinite mana generation. By protecting important pieces with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Bristly Bill, Spine Sower, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Green Sun's Zenith to find key pieces quickly, the deck aims to be fast and consistent in executing its combo strategy while disrupting opponent's plans with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares.

The main idea of this deck is to use the card Doomsday to set up a win condition by stacking the library in a specific order. This combo relies on fast mana acceleration like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to quickly cast Doomsday, followed by using cards like Thassa's Oracle or Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to win the game. The inclusion of control elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. This combo strategy allows the player to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, overwhelming their opponent with threats that are difficult to deal with. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The key strategy is to play Phyrexian Dreadnought and then use cards like Dress Down and Doorkeeper Thrull to minimize its downside. Additionally, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle to counter their spells and activate abilities. The deck also includes card draw and deck manipulation to ensure consistency and find key pieces when needed.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Entomb and Reanimate to quickly get powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent onto the battlefield. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's game plan. The deck's key strategy is to efficiently reanimate high-impact creatures while using counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately aiming to overwhelm them with powerful threats and control the game tempo.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize the card Doomsday as the primary win condition, combining powerful card selection like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up a winning combination. The deck also includes disruption and protection elements such as Force of Will and Daze to control the game state. Additionally, the deck features Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thassa's Oracle as key pieces to help execute the combo and win the game. Overall, the deck focuses on efficiently assembling the Doomsday combo while controlling the game through disruption and protection spells.

The main focus of this combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with as many creatures as possible, using cards like Boggart Trawler and Narcomoeba. By casting spells like Dark Ritual and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to quickly play out its entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Balustrade Spy, who can mill the opponent's entire deck. Pact of Negation helps protect the combo from disruption, while cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan.
